tasks.title: Setup Next.js Project and Infrastructure
tasks.description: Initialize the Next.js project with TypeScript, configure essential development tools, and set up the MongoDB database connection.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project with TypeScript support using `npx create-next-app@latest --typescript`
2. Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality
3. Set up environment variables for database connection and API keys
4. Create MongoDB Atlas cluster with proper security settings
5. Implement connection utility for MongoDB
6. Set up project directory structure following Next.js conventions
7. Configure Tailwind CSS for styling
8. Create initial README with project overview
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project structure and configuration by running the development server and confirming MongoDB connection. Create a simple test component to verify Tailwind CSS is working correctly.

subtasks.title: Initialize Next.js Project with TypeScript and Development Tools
subtasks.description: Create a new Next.js project with TypeScript, configure code quality tools, and set up the project directory structure.
subtasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project using `npx create-next-app@latest --typescript`
2. Configure ESLint by extending the default configuration in `.eslintrc.json`
3. Set up Prettier with a `.prettierrc` file for code formatting
4. Configure Tailwind CSS by following the official Next.js integration guide
5. Create the project directory structure:
   - `/app`: For Next.js 13+ App Router
   - `/components`: Reusable UI components
   - `/lib`: Utility functions and shared logic
   - `/models`: Database schemas
   - `/public`: Static assets
6. Create initial README.md with project overview, setup instructions, and structure description
7. Test the setup by running the development server with `npm run dev`

subtasks.title: Set Up MongoDB Connection and Environment Configuration
subtasks.description: Configure environment variables, create a MongoDB Atlas cluster, and implement a database connection utility.
subtasks.details:
1. Create a MongoDB Atlas account if not already done
2. Set up a new cluster with appropriate security settings:
   - Configure IP whitelist
   - Create a database user with appropriate permissions
3. Create a `.env.local` file for local environment variables
4. Add the following variables to `.env.local`:
   - `MONGODB_URI`: Connection string for MongoDB
   - Any API keys needed for the project
5. Create a `.env.example` file with dummy values as a template
6. Create `/lib/mongodb.ts` utility file to handle database connection:
   - Implement connection pooling
   - Add error handling for connection failures
   - Create a reusable connection function
7. Add environment variable validation to ensure required variables are present
8. Test the MongoDB connection by running a simple query in a test script

subtasks.title: Create Database Schema Models and Connection Test Page
subtasks.description: Define MongoDB schema models and create a test page to verify the database connection is working correctly.
subtasks.details:
1. Create a base schema model in `/models/index.ts` for shared functionality
2. Create a simple test schema (e.g., `/models/User.ts`) with basic fields
3. Implement schema validation using Mongoose or a similar validation library
4. Create a test API route at `/app/api/test-db/route.ts` that:
   - Connects to the database
   - Performs a simple query
   - Returns a success/error message
5. Create a simple UI page at `/app/test-db/page.tsx` that:
   - Displays a button to test the database connection
   - Shows connection status and results
   - Handles and displays any connection errors
6. Add error logging for database connection issues
7. Test the complete setup by:
   - Running the development server
   - Accessing the test page
   - Verifying successful database connection
8. Document the database structure and connection process in README.md

tasks.title: Implement Core Database Models
tasks.description: Define and implement MongoDB schemas for all required data models including Competitor, Key Person, Product, Update, and User.
tasks.details:
1. Create Mongoose schemas for each model with proper validation:
   - Competitor: name, website, LinkedIn URL, description, status
   - Key Person: name, title, company (ref to Competitor), LinkedIn URL
   - Product: name, description, specs, pricing, competitor (ref)
   - Update: type, source, content, timestamp, importance, competitor (ref)
   - User: email, password (hashed), role, notification preferences
2. Implement model relationships and references
3. Create indexes for frequently queried fields
4. Add timestamps for created/updated tracking
5. Create database seeding script with sample data for development
tasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for each model to verify schema validation, required fields, and relationships. Test CRUD operations on each model to ensure proper functionality.

tasks.title: Implement Authentication System
tasks.description: Create a secure authentication system with login, registration, and role-based access control.
tasks.details:
1. Implement NextAuth.js for authentication
2. Create login and registration pages with form validation
3. Set up JWT token-based authentication
4. Implement password hashing with bcrypt
5. Create role-based middleware for authorization (admin, user)
6. Add protected routes and API endpoints
7. Implement session management
8. Create user profile management page
9. Add password reset functionality
tasks.testStrategy: Test user registration, login, and logout flows. Verify role-based access control by attempting to access protected routes with different user roles. Test password reset flow and session persistence.

tasks.title: Create Web Scraping Infrastructure
tasks.description: Implement the core web scraping functionality to monitor competitor websites using Firecrawl API.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Firecrawl API integration with proper error handling
2. Create a scraping configuration system for different website patterns
3. Implement scraper factory to handle various website structures
4. Create storage mechanism for raw scraped data
5. Implement rate limiting and robots.txt compliance
6. Set up Vercel Cron Jobs for scheduled scraping
7. Create logging system for scraping jobs
8. Implement error handling and notification for failed jobs
9. Create admin interface to manage scraping targets and schedules
tasks.testStrategy: Test scraping against sample competitor websites. Verify data extraction accuracy and handling of different website structures. Test scheduled jobs and error handling by intentionally causing failures.

tasks.title: Implement LinkedIn Monitoring
tasks.description: Create functionality to monitor competitor LinkedIn profiles and company pages for updates and changes.
tasks.details:
1. Research and implement LinkedIn data access method (API or scraping)
2. Create company page monitoring functionality
3. Implement key person activity tracking
4. Set up scheduled LinkedIn data collection
5. Create filtering for relevant LinkedIn updates
6. Develop algorithms to detect significant personnel changes
7. Create storage system for LinkedIn data
8. Link LinkedIn data with competitor profiles in the database
tasks.testStrategy: Test LinkedIn monitoring against sample company pages and profiles. Verify the system correctly identifies and extracts relevant updates. Test the linking of LinkedIn data to competitor profiles in the database.

tasks.title: Develop Change Detection and Analysis System
tasks.description: Create algorithms to detect meaningful changes in scraped data, categorize updates, and assign importance scores.
tasks.details:
1. Implement diff algorithm to detect website changes between scrapes
2. Create change significance scoring system based on content and context
3. Develop categorization logic for different update types (product launch, pricing change, etc.)
4. Implement historical comparison functionality
5. Create pipeline for processing raw scraped data
6. Develop importance scoring algorithm based on keywords and patterns
7. Create system to link updates to relevant competitors and products
8. Implement unified data structure for both website and LinkedIn updates
tasks.testStrategy: Test with historical scrape data to verify change detection accuracy. Create test cases for different types of changes to ensure proper categorization. Verify importance scoring with various update scenarios.

tasks.title: Create Notification System
tasks.description: Implement email notification system for delivering weekly digests and critical updates to users.
tasks.details:
1. Set up email sending with Amazon SES or SendGrid
2. Create responsive email templates for digests and notifications
3. Implement email digest generation from detected updates
4. Create user notification preferences in user profile
5. Set up scheduling for weekly email digests
6. Implement immediate notifications for critical updates
7. Create email delivery tracking and reporting
8. Add unsubscribe functionality
tasks.testStrategy: Test email generation with sample update data. Verify email formatting across different email clients. Test notification preferences to ensure users only receive desired updates. Verify scheduling system for weekly digests.

tasks.title: Develop Dashboard and Visualization Components
tasks.description: Create the main dashboard interface with data visualization, filtering, and competitor overview features.
tasks.details:
1. Implement overview dashboard with key metrics
2. Create update feed component with filtering options
3. Develop competitor selector and filter components
4. Implement charts and graphs using Chart.js or Recharts
5. Create data visualization for trends over time
6. Develop interactive dashboard elements
7. Implement dashboard customization features
8. Create competitor profile pages with product catalogs
9. Develop historical update timeline views
tasks.testStrategy: Test dashboard with sample data to verify all visualizations render correctly. Test filtering functionality to ensure it correctly narrows displayed data. Verify responsive design works on different screen sizes.

tasks.title: Implement Search and Advanced Filtering
tasks.description: Create robust search functionality and advanced filtering options for updates and competitor data.
tasks.details:
1. Set up full-text search functionality using MongoDB Atlas Search
2. Implement advanced filtering options (date range, importance, update type)
3. Create saved search functionality for users
4. Develop search results display with highlighting
5. Implement competitor and product filtering
6. Create update type filtering
7. Develop date range selector component
8. Implement sorting options for search results
tasks.testStrategy: Test search functionality with various query terms. Verify filters correctly narrow results. Test saved searches to ensure they restore the exact same search parameters. Verify performance with large datasets.

tasks.title: Perform Comprehensive Testing and Optimization
tasks.description: Conduct thorough testing, performance optimization, and prepare documentation for launch.
tasks.details:
1. Conduct comprehensive functional testing of all features
2. Perform cross-browser compatibility testing
3. Test responsive design on multiple devices
4. Optimize frontend performance (code splitting, lazy loading)
5. Improve database query performance
6. Enhance API response times
7. Implement additional caching as needed
8. Create user documentation and help guides
9. Set up analytics tracking
10. Perform security testing and address any vulnerabilities
11. Create deployment documentation
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct end-to-end testing of all critical user flows. Perform load testing to simulate multiple concurrent users. Use Lighthouse and other tools to measure and optimize performance. Conduct security vulnerability assessment focusing on authentication and data protection.
